channel.title: Runescape
channel.description:
Every so often I venture over to Runescape to see whats going on
Ironman Mode Free players and members Ever wondered how fast you could progress through RuneScape without the help of anyone else? No trade, no helpful multiplayer minigames, no Treasure Hunter, no LootShare, no gifts from friends? If so, Ironman is for you! Ironman is a brand new way of playing RuneScape, developed by you, but now with official support from Jagex. It’s all about self-sufficiency, earning or making everything you use when playing the game. You'll be able to create a new account and set it to Ironman mode, fending for yourself and knowing that all your achievements are your own. If you’d like an even greater challenge, our Hardcore Ironman mode features permadeath with two earnable lives. After that it’s game over. There are brand new hiscore tables to support each of the modes so you’ll be able to gloat about your adventures to everyone! For more information about Ironman, keep an eye on Mod Pips's Ironman forum post, or watch BTS Video 119:
seem's like a cool update to me https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8BifkV2C5bI#t=275

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:20, topic:547068”][quote author=Travas link=topic=665969.msg4455341#msg4455341 date=1414444168]

[quote author=Spades link=topic=665969.msg4454966#msg4454966 date=1414137310]

I always used to think about this, way back in the mid 2000s. Like, has anyone ever managed to get 99 in every stat without any communication to other players? And here JaGeX is, thinking of these ideas 8 years later…
[/quote]they didn’t think of it, it got popular enough among the players the community team decided to ask the developers ti officially implement it.

Right, like most of their good ideas nowadays.

They have good ideas? Seems like most of their stuff now-a-days is pretty crappy. I got on to play their Halloween event, I found it quite boring, and seemed like something they just threw together last minute.
[/quote]They finally realized that paying to implement content that will be gone in less than 2 weeks was a waste of time and money. That new quest looks pretty cool though.

It isn’t a waste of time if we are paying to play their game. Cost’s $65+ USD a year to play their game, the least they can do is give us fancy holiday events.[/quote]Considering the content is also free to play and isn’t permanent, yes it is a waste of developers time. It doesn’t cost anything a year to play their game. It’s your choice to buy membership. You’re not buying membership to play a holiday event. You’re buying it to play the content that will always be there, or else it would just be a waste. This is exactly why they stopped having drop events for holidays because people would miss out and take it way too seriously and cry over it. So quit complaining about the events because at least you have something.

Read full topic

@Spades wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:19, topic:547068”][quote author=Spades link=topic=665969.msg4454966#msg4454966 date=1414137310]

[quote author=reyx7 link=topic=665969.msg4454947#msg4454947 date=1414117034]

I always used to think about this, way back in the mid 2000s. Like, has anyone ever managed to get 99 in every stat without any communication to other players? And here JaGeX is, thinking of these ideas 8 years later…
[/quote]they didn’t think of it, it got popular enough among the players the community team decided to ask the developers ti officially implement it.

Right, like most of their good ideas nowadays.

They have good ideas? Seems like most of their stuff now-a-days is pretty crappy. I got on to play their Halloween event, I found it quite boring, and seemed like something they just threw together last minute.
[/quote]They finally realized that paying to implement content that will be gone in less than 2 weeks was a waste of time and money. That new quest looks pretty cool though.[/quote]
It isn’t a waste of time if we are paying to play their game. Cost’s $65+ USD a year to play their game, the least they can do is give us fancy holiday events.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Elrick:

I have to wonder how many of them just stopped playing the account once they died twice though. And I still doubt it will take off, even if plenty of people have done this over the years.

It has made underpopulated towns/cities like Lumbridge, Draynor, Falador, etc. populated once more for the time being. If you play in legacy, it might even start to feel like RuneScape from a few years ago.

Read full topic

only one way to find out, its actually refreshing not being able to use the bank really makes you think about how you are going to do things.

item.description:

Miss Silabsoft:

I personally bought a membership to play it TheSilabsoft

Does Jagex still ban your accounts?

OT: I think it’s an interesting idea. Going to be cool to see how people progress on their own. No buying 99’s, would like to see someone completely max on their own.

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:5, topic:547068”]Seems super boring, unless there is something like a 5x exp rate. With games like Minecraft that have Hardcore, it’s no big if you die. Sure you lost some diamonds and maybe a cool house, but it’s not like you just lost dozens of hours only to DC while at GWD and then asking yourself why you ever bothered to play that stupid mode.

If there was a decent modifier on it, then sure I’d try it out. If it’s just purely regular RS except you don’t get to have any fun, then I don’t see this taking off.[/quote]

Many players have already done challenges like this before, so that’s where Jagex got the idea from.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Seems super boring, unless there is something like a 5x exp rate. With games like Minecraft that have Hardcore, it’s no big if you die. Sure you lost some diamonds and maybe a cool house, but it’s not like you just lost dozens of hours only to DC while at GWD and then asking yourself why you ever bothered to play that stupid mode.

If there was a decent modifier on it, then sure I’d try it out. If it’s just purely regular RS except you don’t get to have any fun, then I don’t see this taking off.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Stealmojo:

So as an ironman, you get to play members free?

No

[hr]

And damn it, this makes me want to renew my membership, again… My OSRS account on my main is like this, I try not to trade or anything. Only problem is I wish I could just enable it on my main, seems like an easy way for them to get money when you have to pay for more membership on a completely different account…

Every so often I venture over to Runescape to see whats going on

Ironman Mode

Free players and members

Ever wondered how fast you could progress through RuneScape without the help of anyone else? No trade, no helpful multiplayer minigames, no Treasure Hunter, no LootShare, no gifts from friends? If so, Ironman is for you!

Ironman is a brand new way of playing RuneScape, developed by you, but now with official support from Jagex.
